channel.title: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!
channel.description: Hey guys, so I recently portforwarded my Server & everybody in my household can connect to the 192.168.1.4 IP. But when I change the EGUI to connect to my actual IP (76.XXX.XXX.XXX) I get an error connecting... therefor people outside of my household will not be able to connect to my server, any ideas on how to fix this!?

item.title: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!
item.dc:creator: @menospy menospy
item.description:
@menospy wrote:

Tutorial:

Also, when you are running a given application on a certain IP and port, that same IP address cannot connect to that application, so you will have to modify your client so that it connects to ‘localhost’.

Ahh that’s probably the problem! I’ll have somebody outside test, thanks man!

Read full topic
item.source: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!

item.title: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

In order for people outside of your network to connect, you must make sure your router is portforwarded so they can bypass your firewall and connect to your private server. Also, when you are running a given application on a certain IP and port, that same IP address cannot connect to that application, so you will have to modify your client so that it connects to ‘localhost’.

Read full topic
item.source: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!

item.title: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!
item.dc:creator: @menospy menospy
item.description:
@menospy wrote:

They can connect to the IPV4. do you have teamviewer? maybe you could help me through that? or even skype?

Read full topic
item.source: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!

item.title: [DELTA] Port-forwarding works for my household [/DELTA] NEED HELP!
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“menospy, post:3, topic:512362”][quote author=strucker link=topic=630607.msg4273066#msg4273066 date=1364699721]
People in your wifi network can only conect to you with your local direction(IPV4) and people outside your wifi network can only connect to you with your ip, and it has to be portforwarded.
[/quote]

Yes, I understand that. My problem is I portforwarded my IPV4 & it works well, but when I try to connect using my IP it doesn’t work… I’m not sure what’s going on with it:/[/quote]People in your household can’t connect to your ip.

Read full topic
